page.title: 07The Manor House
page.content: This is now a private residence, Previously owned by British Steel and used for administration. It is thought it was built as a Royal shooting box in the 15 C. It would have been situated with the rest of the village in a clearing in{Rockingham Forest. } In the first half of the 16 C {Edward {,son of Thomas Montague}was born at Brigstock and later became {Speaker of {the House of Commons.}One of his younger sons was known as Roger of Brigstock and it was to him and his heirs for ever that James I was granted the manor of Brigstock. Roger died without issue and the manor passed to his nephew Sir Edward Montague. The property was surrounded by a moat fed by the waters of{Harpers {Brook, }which flows through the garden. The moat is in a good state of preservation.
